greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of 'a', an auxiliary constant associated with the asymptotic probability of success in the secretary problem when the number of applicants is uniformly distributed.
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, Section 5.15 Optimal stopping constants, p. 361.
link: Steven R. Finch, Errata and Addenda to Mathematical Constants. p. 45.
formula: e^a*(1 - gamma - log(a) + Ei(-a)) - (gamma + log(a) - Ei(a)) = 1, where gamma is Euler's constant and Ei is the exponential integral function.
mathematica: a /. FindRoot[E^a*(1 - EulerGamma - Log[a] + ExpIntegralEi[-a]) - (EulerGamma + Log[a] - ExpIntegralEi[a]) == 1, {a, 2}, WorkingPrecision -> 100] // RealDigits // First
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 01 2014
